meanings.definition: To engage in discussions or meetings to make decisions or plan strategies.
meanings.sent1: We were caucussing about the best way to solve the problem.
meanings.sent2: The team is caucussing to finalize the project details.
meanings.sent3: The animals were caucussing in the barn about who gets to eat the last carrot.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the trees were caucussing with the wind about when to fall.
meanings.sent5: The students were caucussing eagerly about the upcoming school event.

meanings.definition: The act of meeting with a group to discuss and decide on a course of action.
meanings.sent1: The caucussing of the board members lasted for hours.
meanings.sent2: Attending the caucussing helped us understand the decision-making process better.
meanings.sent3: The funny part of the play was when the characters had a caucussing on stage.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to be having a caucussing with the sun about the weather.
meanings.sent5: The caucussing in the town hall was filled with passionate arguments.
